document.masterDocTitle: Five new species of Hypseloecus Reuter (Hemiptera: Miridae) on hemiparasitic Santalales from India

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Five new species of Hypseloecus Reuter (Hemiptera: Miridae) on hemiparasitic Santalales from India

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Recognized by combination of brown and red coloration of the hemelytra, first segment of antenna brown; endosoma twisted at base, secondary gonopore with fringes of glassy spicules distad, apex flattened, broad.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. Know from the type locality Karnataka, north of Bangalore, Hessaraghatta
Etymology. Named for its pointed phallotheca.

Discussion. On the basis of male genitalia,
H. acutus
is closely related to
H. metamyemi S
chuh & Menard, but differs by curved endosoma, fattened apex and left paramere with curved posterior processes. Externally
H. acutus
is distinguished by smaller size, dorsum reddish brown with pale brown areas on pronotum and pale cuneal incisures, whereas
H. metamyemi
is weakly orange or deep reddish brown and larger in size.
